title.rendered: Emmanuel College Choir at the Travellers Club

content.rendered:
On Thursday 21st March, members of the Cambridge Society, and members of Emmanuel College, are cordially invited to an evening at the Travellers Club for a performance by the Choir of Emmanuel College.

The concert will start at 18h30. Following the performance there will be a chance to mingle briefly with the choir in the Travellers bar. The evening will then end at 20h00 in time for attendees to leave for their dinners.

The programme will include:

    • Motets by Rachmaninov, Gorecki and Robert Parsons
    • Musikalische Exequien by Heinrich Schutz
    • Works by William Mathias and Benjamin Britten

Dress code is Smart, Elegant (jacket and tie for men).

Tickets are free but the number of places is limited, so we do ask you only to book if you intend to come – and to let us know if you are no-longer able to make it so we can allocate your ticket to somebody else.

There are separate availabilities depending on whether you are a member of Emmanuel or not, so please specify this by booking the correct ticket.

Each member – Society or Emmanuel – is welcome to bring one guest.

Grand Salon, Travellers Club
Hôtel de la Païva
25, avenue des Champs-Elysées
75008, Paris

This is an event organised jointly between the Society and Emmanuel.
